channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dan Osborn to Seek Pete Ricketts’s Nebraska Senate Seat, Stressing Class Issues
item.description: A steamfitter and former union leader, running as an independent but with Democratic support, will take on the Republican incumbent, a billionaire’s s...

item.title: Elon Musk calls the U.S. dollar ‘hopeless,’ says his America Party will embrace Bitcoin
item.description: Short statement could have broad implications.

item.title: Users accuse Elon Musk’s Grok of a rightward tilt after xAI changes its internal instructions to assume viewpoints from the media are ‘biased’
item.description: Grok’s new instructions tell it not to shy away from “politically incorrect” viewpoints.

item.title: Man Dies at Milan Airport After Being Sucked Into Jet Engine, Official Says
item.description: The man was neither an airport employee nor a passenger. Milan Bergamo Airport did not say how he had accessed the runway where the plane was.

item.title: Trump’s U-Turn on Weapons Leaves Ukrainians Hopeful but Cautious

item.title: The Mexican Businessman Grateful for Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: A small company in northern Mexico had faced steep competition from China in making straps, plugs, fasteners, grommets, zip ties and clamps. Now, U.S....

item.title: Tesla sold precisely zero cars in Turkey in January—now it’s Elon Musk’s hottest market. Here’s why
item.description: The Eurasian country came within striking distance of becoming Tesla's third largest global market for the month of June, but analysts question the su...

item.title: Tesla bull Dan Ives says the company has reached a ‘tipping point’ and lays out a 3-point plan for the board to rein in Elon Musk
item.description: The analyst thinks Musk needs a new pay plan and a board committee that's dedicated to limiting, but not banning, the CEO's political activities.

item.title: The Wild Russian Plot to Burn a London Restaurant and Kidnap Its Owner

item.title: Meet the ex-Amazon exec who pitched Prime Day to Jeff Bezos—and turned the slowest shopping season into a $14.2 billion sales empire
item.description: You can thank Diego Piacentini, the architect of Prime Day, for one of the biggest online retail events of the year.

item.title: Four Men Charged in Extremist Terrorist Plot to Seize Land Near Quebec City
item.description: The police seized a large cache of guns and explosives and said that the ‘ideologically motivated’ group included members of Canada’s military.
